verses.verse: (For the choir director; upon an eight-stringed lyre. A Psalm of David.) Help, <S%H3467><s%> Lord, <S%H3068><s%> for the godly <S%H2623><s%> man <S%H2623><s%> ceases <S%H1584><s%> to be, For the faithful <S%H539><s%> disappear <S%H6461><s%> from among the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>

They speak <S%H1696><s%> falsehood <S%H7723><s%> to one <S%H376><s%> another; <S%H7453><s%> With flattering <S%H9142><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> and with a double <S%H3820><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> they speak. <S%H1696><s%>

May the Lord <S%H3068><s%> cut <S%H3772><s%> off <S%H3772><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> flattering <S%H9142><s%> lips, <S%H8193><s%> The tongue <S%H3956><s%> that speaks <S%H1696><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> things; <S%H1419><s%>
Who <S%H834><s%> have said, <S%H559><s%> "With our tongue <S%H3956><s%> we will prevail; <S%H1396><s%> Our lips <S%H8193><s%> are our own; who <S%H4310><s%> is lord <S%H113><s%> over us?"

"Because <S%H4480><s%> of the devastation <S%H7701><s%> of the afflicted, <S%H6041><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of the groaning <S%H603><s%> of the needy, <S%H34><s%> Now <S%H6258><s%> I will arise, <S%H6965><s%>" says <S%H559><s%> the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> "I will set <S%H7896><s%> him in the safety <S%H3468><s%> for which he longs. <S%H6315><s%>"

The words <S%H565><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> are pure <S%H2889><s%> words; <S%H565><s%> As silver <S%H3701><s%> tried <S%H6884><s%> in a furnace <S%H5948><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> refined <S%H2212><s%> seven <S%H7659><s%> times. <S%H7659><s%>
Thou, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> wilt keep <S%H8104><s%> them; Thou wilt preserve <S%H5341><s%> him from this <S%H2098><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> strut <S%H1980><s%> about on every <S%H5439><s%> side, <S%H5439><s%> When vileness <S%H2149><s%> is exalted <S%H7311><s%> among the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>
